intro: Telanthophora uspantanensis, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
